Loretta: ^Hey! Things have finally quieted down, so we can talk, if you still want to.

g-0: ^He's a PI who's helping me find Heather.
^Oh... That's odd. I've never seen you around the bar, I don't think...
^When I drink I rather do it from the comfort of my apartment.
^Nice to meet you Loretta, I'm also looking for some missing fans of the band.
^Inez, are you two friends? You've never told me about knowing a vampire PI.
g-1: ^Sorry, with your moustache is hard to see if you have any fangs.
g-2: ^Yes! Uh, you want to know about Heather and the fans, correct?
^I already told Inez that I, personally, think she probably just left because she wanted to.
^But I'll help however I can if you believe it might be something more serious, Inez.

questionsloretta: ^Have you seen this group of friends? *show picture*
^Did she mention if she was going somewhere?
^Noticed any odd behavior from her recently?
^What is your relationship with Heather like?
groupfriends: ^Yeah, I've seen them... But they haven't been around for a month at least.
^Never talked to them, though. They didn't drink a lot, mostly came for the band.
^Alec probably knows more than me... He and Heather always had a chat with the fans after the performances.
^Sorry to interrupt, but Jo mentioned you might know something about fans seeking out magical - or rather supernatural beings...
^Oh, she mentioned that? But that wasn't about the band... They were bothering me, actually.
^A few roudy, drunk and uneducated people who heard from someone who heard from someone and thought it would be funny to mock the bartender about it.
^No worries, they were taken care of.

s: ^How come I never heard about this?

c-0: ^You were outside, and like I said, I handled it. Alec helped.
^Jesus, ok. But you're sure they weren't the ones in the picture, right?
^Jo actually thought Heather had something to do with these people.

c-1: ^Yes, actually I do love pointing fingers.

g-1: ^Who else could've been? We didn't have these kinds of problems before she came around.
^But then again, it's not only her fault if you consider how everyone here coddled her all the time. Nothing worse than a spoiled vampire.

s: ^Coddled her? Who are you talking about?

g-2: ^I mean, you Inez. And Jo. And Alec. If you're going to turn someone you should be resposible for them understanding the consequences, keeping them in line.
^Can we maybe move on to the next question?

goingsomewhere: ^She wouldn't tell it to me. If Inez doesn't know anything about it then I sure am not going to.
^Maybe she could've seeked out advice from someone more neutral...
^I'm not neutral. And she doesn't want my advice.
oddbehaviour: ^First we need to establish what's normal behaviour for Heather.

^There was something that caught my attention... That entire thing with her quitting the band, avoiding Alec. That seemed very unlike her, considering how she always insisted on them putting more work into the band.
^I wonder if... How much have you told him, Inez?
^I know you looked at her through rose colored glasses, so I'm afraid to seem petty by complaining about her if he doesn't know the entire context.

s: ^If you don't trust me then go ahead and fill him in.

c-0: ^It's not like that, honey! This is an investigation, so I'm just being careful...
c-1: ^You're too nice, but I am actually a little petty.
g-0: ^The thing is Heather struggled with her vampiric nature, no doubt, but I something switched in her these last few months that made her increasingly sympathetic towards humans.
^You can't live as a vampire having these kinds of feelings. She didn't want to kill and spent as much time as she could actively starving herself. A lot of things can happen once a vampire starves.
^For Heather, she always ended up going on an insane killing spree.
^And we were the ones left to clean it up. Me, Inez, Alec and all the others in the coven always try to be careful, but what she was doing... It was hard not to raise suspicion around the city.
^And then she felt guilty and everything started all over again...
^As much as we had our differences, it was hard seeing a vampire like that. I wished I could've done more to help her.
^Indeed I did not know these things about her... I'm sure Inez had her reasons for not telling, which we'll discuss later.

relationship: ^C'mon, Inez. You know what it was like.

g-0: ^Also I wanna hear you explain it with your own words.
^I was... polite to her, you can say that.

^I guess it's that thing when you when know you're not really friends with someone because your personalities don't match but you're both forced to interact because you know the same people and go to the same places?
^We had different world views. Being over 200 years old, I honestly have little patience for baby vampires. Particularly Heather who was far from the best choice for this.
^Unfortunately, in the end, there's no vampire council one must go through. We all have the power to turn another, if we choose to do so.
^Of course! I got no reason to lie, honey. Specially when Inez and everyone else can confirm or deny everything I say.

s: ^They didn't like each other at all.

g-1: ^I tolerated her, she tolerated me. It's not like we ever got into a fight or anything. Heather is still a vampire, so I still feel more sympathetic towards her than to any human.

opinionothers: ^Jo... She has harsh personality, and always talks like she's late for something, but I appreciate genuine she is.
^She wants what's best for the bar and has a good eye for business, so I was very glad to see how receptive she was to my suggestions.
^It's hard to believe, but when Jo died and took her ghost form she was very lost, couldn't interact with humans properly without freaking them out.
^She didn't know how maintain the bar like that. So I came to her with the proposal to cater to a new clientele, make the place more vampire friendly, with blood based drinks on the menu.
^So then this would become a safe place for vampires passsing by, and in exchange everytime we have to deal with a human I can do it for her.
^Now Alec... He and I see eye to eye on a lot of things when it comes to vampire life, the precautionos we should take, how we have to stick together.
^He was the first vampire I met in the city. I introduced him to Jo and got the band to play here. This was all before Heather came along.
^He's also someone who tends to not plan that much ahead, probably why he decided to turn Heather after Inez refused.
^Huh? Heather asked you first, Inez? Interesting...
^Ops, should I've not told him that?

s: ^It's ok, it's all in the past.

c-1: ^Sorry, Inez. I guess it doesn't really matter now, either way.
g-0: ^But Alec will never admit when he's wrong, so he just lets Heather do whatever.
^Lately he seems more and more impacient with her, even came to talk to me about it because he knows what I think about Heather's behaviour.
^Except she doesn't listen to me and I've made my peace with that. Guess he thought she would listen to him...
^Alec's got this thing with authority, he likes to pretend we're all the same, but that's because he's used to people naturally listening to him.
^So when Heather didn't do that it hurt his ego and they stopped talking to each other.
^This is just my theory, tho! I don't know details and I don't want to gossip anymore about what he told me, you should ask him directly...
^But maybe don't mention you heard it from me.

thatsall: ^Unless Bernard has something he wants to ask...
^Well, yes. First, thank you, Loretta. Let me just get back on a few things...
^You said you had a problem with Heather even while she was still human, can you elaborate on why?
^I told you guys, we just have different personalities.
^Yes, everyone has different personalities. What made you not like hers?
^Uh... I'd rather not... Do you really want me to badmouth her in front of Inez?

c-0: ^ It's probably not anything I don't already know.
g-0: ^Okay, I guess you have a point.
^Let's just say the biggest thing is: not being considerate to everyone around. It's always me me me with Heather.
^She has Inez and Alec trying to help her all the time and I just can't see her really caring about them. A lot of vampires out there don't have anyone.
^It's very easy for a vampire to be lonely and she takes the companionship she has for granted.

s: ^I see how it can come across as that.

g-1: ^Of course not, I work surrounded by people everyday.
^Hm... I think that was it, Loretta. Thank you so much for answering all of our questions.
^Inez and I have a lot to talk about now...

b: ^ Loretta's a tricky one, isn't she?

g-0: ^She certainly had a lot to say.
^On one hand, I did feel like she was being genuine with her opinions, wasn't trying to hide anything. Well, maybe a thing or two.
^On the other, she did try to point us in a lot of different directions, time will tell if intentionally or not.
^Even to you, Inez. You know I have to ask, what was that about refusing to turn Heather?

s: ^I don't like the idea of turning anyone.

c-2: ^It's not all about Heather. As someone who was unconscious and woke up suddenly as a vampire... Wasn't given a choice or anything...
^I agree with what Loretta said, turning someone, that's a big responsibility.
^If things didn't work out... I wouldn't be able to forgive myself.
^That's what I thought at the time.
^But the joke's on me because, even if I wasn't the one to turn Heather, I still cared too much about her not to get involved.
c-3: ^I wasn't totally against the idea, but at that time I thought it would do her more harm than good.
^I think she was just feeling helpless about a lot of things in her life and wanted to gain some power. It was the 60's.
^But can you even turn someone a vampire for the right reasons? Or the right time and place for that?

g-1: ^When I found out Alec turned her...

c-5: ^In the end, a part of me was relieved it happened. That someone else did it.

g-2: ^Because then we got to be together for real, as vampires.
^There, I told you. Anyways, to me it's all in the past.
^I appreciate that, Inez. Did you voice your concerns to Loretta or Heather herself at the time?

c-6: ^I think I owed her an explanation. She didn't like it, but understood.
c-7: ^I didn't know Heather for that long. I needed to get a second opinion and Loretta and I were closer.

g-3: ^Even though the feelings were there, I was still being careful around Heather while she was still human.
^Loretta seemed to resent how things changed in the coven after Heather showed up...

c-8: ^ On and off for a while.
c-9: ^ More than once, but it was never serious...

g-4: ^It was already over before I even met Heather.
^But that doesn't have to do with anything.

c-10: ^ Loretta was never that into me.

g-5: ^She was pretty clear about the reasons why she doesn't like Heather.
^Let me tell you something, unless you're in her head, you can't know for certain.
^But I'll take your word for it in the meantime.

c-11: ^It didn't happen that many times and she hasn't done that for a while.
^There were some bad times, we all get those.
c-12: ^There were... Incidents. A few bad times.
^The real problem is her being reckless, both with herself and the coven.
^She wouldn't listen and we- I don't know how to help her with that.
^Theres no way to help someone who doesn't want to be helped...

c-14: ^ There's just a lot going on.

g-7: ^And when was her last killing spree?
^Noted. Inez, I hope you weren't keeping that from me on purpose.
^Loretta said a lot of things, but she was eager to talk about Alec, specifically, we definitely need to get him talking to verify all of that, so let's get to that.

BreakRoom: ^Our break room. Every employee has a locker here.
^Anyway we can take a look inside?
open_alec_locker: ^Inez, can you please check the door while I search?

g-0: ^The inside of this backpack is surprisingly organized...
^Yeah, doesn't look like it, but Alec's king of a neat freak.
^But I guess his entire life is somewhat of an organized chaos.
^I see an extra pair of drumsticks, a wallet with... a lot of money actually. And what is clearly a fake ID.
^Huh, a keychain with a pocket knife as a charm... How punk.
^Perfume... Eyeliner and eyeshadow, I believe? Next to some hand sanitizer and baby wipes.
^Interesting... An old collection of poems by some eastern european authors.
^I don't think I've ever seen him not carry that around.
^Even if you're able to change with the times, sometimes you still need to cling to what's familiar...
^So that's it, huh? Just regular Alec stuff.
^A paper wristband? Could be from a party, Alec gets invited to all kinds of things.
^No, I don't think so. This is a hospital bracelet, but the name of who it belongs to is covered in blood.
g-1: ^We should keep this. Now to the jacket...
^Some receipts, mostly from drugstore, and a fidelity card from the library.
^But here's another keychain! This one's got some charms attached to it, unlike the one in the backpack.
^Wait, this is Heather's, I could recognize that tiny bat anywhere.
^This is the key to her locker, this is from the apartment, backdoor...

c-2: ^I see. But I bet our drummer friend knows, we should use this to get some answers, at last.

b: ^ You know I could just bust the door out...
^It's tempting, but we should keep them wanting to cooperate with us, at least for the time being.

open_loretta_locker: ^She likes it. Loretta is a very hands on.
^Lets see... Lipstick, a comb, a wallet... Cat treats?
^Hair clip, face cream, a pager, that's interesting...
^She handles a lot of stuff for the bar. Seems like it's all just regular things.
^Which means we need to be even more meticulous... Let me check again.
^Hm, take a look at this. A hospital ID card.
^That's Loretta's picture, is it not? But the name says Dr. Michelle Ricci.

c-0: ^Don't know, but I doubt she's over there curing patients.
^That reminds me, didn't you say one of the young humans I'm looking for was spotted at a hospital?
^Could be connected somehow, we should go back to talk to her about it.

b: ^ Time to find out what else she left behind...
^Did she take the key with her? I didn't see it back at the apartment.

open_heather_locker: ^Damn, what is that smell? What's in this?
^I can't... It's too much for me, I have a very keen sense of smell because of my-
^Because of dog senses, I get it.
^Hm. There are some severed fingers here.
^What?! Stop holding them like that! Disgusting.
^"Told you this would happen. Tell anyone and there will be more."
^Smells like it's been there a while too.
^Looks like someone was threatening her. That's our first strong indicative she probably didn't leave own her own volition.
^Does it look like they could be from a vampire?
^I mean... A severed finger is not that big of a deal for a vampire. It would likely grow back.
^Know anyone who lost a finger recently?
^I... I have more questions than answers.
^Could it be that Heather was the one who was going to send this to someone?
^I don't know that she has that in her. Also that's not her handwriting.
^Which one of our suspects has that in them?

s: ^Jo did mention Heather might owe her money.

c-0: ^But I have no idea what he would threaten her about.
c-1: ^But would she go to this length?

b: ^ What about that dead body? Could it have belonged to him?
^ Let's keep that note, could be useful later.
^Just keep them in the locker. We are the ones with the key now, so no one will try and mess with it, for now.
^We should talk to more people, gather more clues.

discussdeadbody: ^I don't think so? Why would Heather care about some random man?
^Looking at the pictures, seems like he had all his fingers, so scratch that.
^But that's a good point. Whose well being would Heather care about enough that it could be used against her?

s: ^Starting to doubt she cared about anyone at all.

c-0: ^I see. It's probably been a lot, finding out there's so much you don't know. But you were right, there's something going on, so be prepared for whatever disappointment might come.
^And stay focused, ok? We'll figure this out.
c-1: ^Hey, I understand, there's a lot you didn't know that we're finding out. But you were right about one thing: something is not right...
^And we're going to find out what happened, just keep focused, ok?
g-0: ^No use speculating while knowing so little. Let's talk to more people, gather more clues.

inez_locker: ^I guess, there's not a lot inside anyways.

^... Is what an annoying costumer would say.
^Is this you and Heather in the picture?
^One of these polaroids that kids theses days are into. Heather wanted to see if we would actually show up on it, I don't know. There are so many crazy rumors about vampires...
^But I think it turned out alright.
^And this hanging below... What is it? Smudged paper?
^It was suppose to be Heather's autograph. I asked her for it when we met. Is not like she was famous or anything, I was teasing her, but she actually gave it to me- Oh, I forgot I had this.
^But haven't been there in ages, I left after I turned.
^It's... from Loretta. She has suppliers everywhere for the bar.

g-0: ^We should get back to looking around.

c-1: ^Wait, this is Heather's guitar pick. Did she go back to practicing and forgot it here?
^I remember when she turned into a vampire and got officially accepted into the band...
^She was always an amazing vocalist, but had a hard time learning the instruments.
^But she picked things up pretty quick, like always.
c-2: ^A key? Is this Alec's? I should keep it.

trashcan2: ^Hey, check this out, there's a few empty bloodbags here.

^Could be, but I don't know anything about it.

s: ^I personally rather drink my blood fresh.

g-1: ^Uh- Interesting detail I'm not sure I needed.

s: ^These were probably really hard to get.

g-2: ^Why go through the trouble of stealing from a hospital with tight security when you can just kill some random human and easily dispose of the body?

trashcan3: ^What is this? Regurtitated pizza? Humans are disgusting...
trashcan4: ^It's not one of the people I'm looking, that's for sure. This man is at least over 40.
^Is it from one of the vampires?
^They wouldn't be so careless as to leave it in some random trashcan. You always need to properly dispose.
^He also doesn't seem to have any bite marks...
^From the little I know about corpse examination, it looks like he's not been dead for more than two days.

s: ^What do you think we should do?
^I'll tell Loretta to get rid of it.

c-0: ^I would usually say to call the police but... In this circumstance it could raise suspicion on the vampires and consequentially do harm to the investigation.
^Regardless, I don't want to be disrespecful...
c-1: ^Wait- I get to wanting the bar to get in trouble, but can't we be a little more mindful?
g-0: ^Maybe we can get it taken somewhere else to be found?
^All this trouble for a dead human?
g-1: ^I'll tell Jo to get ghosts to remove it.

b: ^ What about that severed finger? Could it have belonged to him?

^Let me just take a picture or two... Ok, done.

discusseveredfinger: ^I mean, he looks like he has all his fingers.

s: ^Starting to doubt she cared about anyone at all.

c-0: ^I see. It's probably been a lot, finding out there's so much you don't know. But you were right, there's something going on, so be prepared for whatever disappointment might come.

c-1: ^Hey, I understand, there's a lot you didn't know that we're finding out.

g-0: ^I think we're done here. Let me just take a picture or two... Ok, ready to leave.

c-2: ^There's a note here with some telephone numbers. So I guess that means...
^She was bullshiting us about not being able to write?
^Yes. Not only that but I believe it's the same handwriting from the note we found in Heather's locker.
^I don't get it, she must have known we would find all this.
^There are also some really old pictures here. What I assume is an youger Jo surrounded by men..?
^The front of the bar, this must be what? Around the turn of the century?
^Doesn't seem to have anything else of interest in here.
c-3: ^That's a lot of documents, this will take a while.

s: ^What would Heather do with all this money?

c-0: ^To keep coming back for more and more money, that's insane.
^She knows what Jo is like, why put herself in this situation? I just feel like I don't know her at all.
c-1: ^This makes no sense... I thought it would've been like 300 max, but 10000? That's insane.
^Why would Jo even agree to this in the first place?
g-0: ^We need to go back and talk to her more.
^One more thing... This doesn't pertain to the investigation, but it made me think...
^This is the deed for the bar with Jo's signature at the bottom.
^I don't have extensive knowledge on ghosts but what I do know is: they must be bound to something material. Something that mattered to them during life.
^From all we've seen of Jo, I wonder if this could be it.
^Could become useful. It's something to consider, you know?
^If it turns out one of these people really did something harm Heather in anyway, you should think about how you want to deal with that- with them.
^Clearly there won't be any legal justice, but there are other ways.

c-2: ^I understand, but know you can always talk to me about it.

c-0: ^Hello! We're returning you to call about the ... would you still like ...?
c-1: ^Hey, about what we talked about before... I know, ok? And I agree, we can't let them come by anymore. I'll handle it.
c-2: ^Jo! Don't worry, ok? I'll get it for you, like I said. Just don't... You were joking when you said you were going to..? Actually, never mind. Just please, please, don't say anything to Inez.
c-3: ^Shit- Just so you're aware, there's been a situation... What the- Made a whole damn mess-

bribe: ^Do you know there's a dead body in the trashcan outside?
^Loretta recognized him as the guy who handled your bloodbag contraband.
^And you don't know what could've happen to leave him like this?
^No. But now I know why we didn't get the shipment today. Loretta's gotta look for someone to replace him soon otherwise we're gonna start running out of bloodbags.
^Forgot you know more about the bar than its own owner.
^Can you get the ghosts to leave him somewhere else?
^Please, it's a special request from me.

^There was also a note, recognize the handwriting?
^No. I'm a ghost, I can't write.
^You said Heather owed you money. What for?
^You know, it could be really important to the investigation to let us take a look at your office...
^It could even help discard you as a suspect...
^I'm a suspect? I had no idea.
^Or, I don't know, we could leak to the hospital that you guys are smuggling bloodbags.

s: ^I would easily give this place away to find Heather.

g-0: ^You know, it's really dumb to threaten me when I'm already doing you both a favour by getting rid of that body...
^Here. Don't take too long and don't leave with anything. I'll check.

s: ^Why not be honest from the start?

c-1: ^I was. I told you Heather owed me money.

g-1: ^15 thousand? What did she need that for?

^She didn't go back to performing or bothered to pay me back. Easy.
^It wasn't as bad as it seemed, just something to give her a scare.
^It wasn't his! It was only suppose to seem like it was.
^I don't even know where he is. It's called a bluff.

c-2: ^Still you don't know if she even saw it.
c-3: ^You don't know if she even saw it, you don't have your money back.

^I really gotta tell these people I'm not listening to all that.

^Yes, we need to check with Loretta. See you later, Jo.
^I got shit to do, so hopefully not.

g-1: ^Let's just hope it's not too late.

^I did, but now that I know she was being threatened, I'm not so sure.
^And if she did, where do you think she would've gone to?
^Probably to become a famous musician. You know, live on the dream. I've already told Inez this.
^Or she went back to her family.
^Heather has a family? An alive one?
^It's only been 20 years since she turned a vampire.
^But it's not easy to keep in touch.
^How do you explain that you can only see them at night, not eat anything, and also not get visibly old..? All while having to live with the fact that you'll outlive every single one of them.
^Either way, Heather's family is not from around here. She hadn't been in contact with them from even before she was a vampire.
^But what makes you think she would go back there?

^She's been mentioning them recently. I think she feels regretful about how things ended, but I told her, you were going to have to cut contact at some point. Guess it's easier when they're already dead, is it not?
^Do you think... The finger could be from one of them?
^To be fair, she didn't really like what I had to say about the subject when she came to talk to me about it.
^I don't get it, really. They're all so boring! And expendable. Expect for Heather, even as a human she was still... Something else.

oddbehaviour2: ^This has to be a joke question.
^You're gonna have to be more specific than that.
^Tell us about her quitting the band.
^She didn't want to play with us anymore. What else is there to tell?
^Care to enlighten us as to why?
^Hm... We were having some issues. She didn't think we took it seriously enough.
^I told her to quit that attitude. This is suppose to be fun! Otherwise what's the point?
^Again: what happens when they realise we don't age? Do we really want that kind of spotlight?
^Don't get me wrong, could be fun for a few years, but it wouldn't last. Then what's left? We outlive all of our fans until no one remembers us anymore.
^Heather has a... I don't know what it is. Need for approval? Let's just say we didn't see eye to eye.
^Jo mentioned to us she might've gotten fed with up the attention from fans.
^Not possible. She loved that shit. Her eyes would shine when someone asked for an autograph.
^Jo's totally projecting. She's the one who doesn't like being around people.
^The times she would starve herself and then go around town murdering people with an uncontrollable hunger.

c-0: ^Now why the fuck would you that?
^Alec, Bernard is not here to arrest anyone, or even to bring justice. He just wants to find out what happened.
^Can you know that for sure? No, you can't. That's why, as I've been saying, vampire business is vampire business.
^Too late now. I said I would help so, what do you want to know?
^Do you think we could've been doing more? That we were just letting her whatever she wants?
c-1: ^And why the fuck would she do that?
^She was answering that same question we just asked you.
^And talking about how we always let Heather do whatever she wants...
^Yes, that's one of Loretta's favorite subjects.
g-0: ^I thought I was handling it... Until everything would happen all over again.

^Every conversation I had with Heather was like that too. Everything I would suggest to her she would come up with a justification in her head as to why that wouldn't work. We went around in circles. Fucking depressing.
^I should've known there was no reasoning with her, she needed more guidance than that. Telling, not asking.
^So yeah, we did "let her do whatever".
^Is that why you two had a fallout?

relationship2: ^We were just the best of friends!
^Is that what you want me to say?
^From what I gather you were the one who turned her into a vampire, yes?
^What say you, Inez? Since you and Loretta were the ones against it.
^He did it to go against me

c-0: ^ Would like to hear from you why you did it.
g-0: ^Er... To be honest you two didn't even cross my mind.
^Long answer: Heather had shown herself to be interesting enough for me to want to keep her around. Couldn't do that if she was still a human.
^She was insistent, came to me first.
^And Inez had already been stupid enough to reveal our nature to her. It was either that or just kill her.
^We ended up liking playing together, that was another big thing. Didn't have a vocalist at the time.
^And yeah, even back then I could tell she had... Issues.
^But why not give the girl a chance? Not like she had a lot going for her as a failed musician anyway.
^I can see why you would think that.

c-2: ^ I obviously don't agree with everything you said, but I get it.
c-3: ^ A gut feeling? Is that what you call turning her into a vampire just so she could sing for your band?

g-1: ^Alright, calm down, that's just what I thought back then.

opinionothers2: ^Loretta is a spiteful bitch, and she knows it. But I do love her.
^I'm a bit of one myself, probably why we understand each other so well. Outside of, you know, all this Heather stuff.
^Jo... Makes me wonder when they're finally gonna come up with xanax for ghosts. I'll make sure she's the first on the list to receive it.
^What can I say? I get on with everyone. Inez is the only one who doesn't like me.

c-0: ^ You're like an annoying little brother.
^Then you should start acting like it.
c-1: ^This is all for show, we have a real brother-sister relationship, don't we?
^I would say more like you're my upstairs neighbour who keeps stumping on the floor.
^Let's just settle on cousins twice removed then.
g-0: ^Oh, I wonder what Jo and Loretta had to say about me?
^Are you two therapists now? No one swore confidentiality.
^I felt like they are both very cautious about you in particular.
^But do you think they could've done something to Heather?

thatsall2: ^Am I really the only one you got something on?
^Because if so, that's honestly sad. What kind of investigation is this?
^We won't disclose our suspicions with you, if that's your intention.
^I'll leave you and Inez to discuss other matters soon, but first, if you could enlighten me on a few things...
^I recall now that Loretta mentioned to us you don't react well when people don't regard you as a figure of authority.
^She said when Heather stopped going along with what you wanted, that might've hurt your ego, and that was the reason for the fallout between you two.
^She really said that? What in the delusion...
^It's honestly funny that she would try to pin it on me the fault for whatever the fuck she thinks was happening with Heather.
^It's baffling, considering how she usually blames Heather for every little thing that goes wrong around here.
^What is she even on about? Trying to play nice in front of Inez? She's the one with a broken ego.
^A twenty year streak of having a broken ego ever since she got dumped.

c-0: ^Not for you, maybe. God, you can be really gullible sometimes, Inez.
c-1: ^Right? And we don't agree on anything ever.
g-0: ^Did you two go through her stuff like you did with mine?
^Well, you should. She keeps her bag behind the counter.
^That's... Good to know. Thank you, Alec.
^Yeah, yeah. I swear, the audacity of some people!
^I'll give you two some space now... Come talk to me when you're done, Inez.

alec_testimony: ^So... Heather actually had another apartment in the neighborhood, that's where one of these keys is from.
^I assume you didn't know, I didn't either, until she asked me to go there a few weeks ago...

s: ^I can't believe she would to that.
^How could you treat her like that?

c-0: ^Me neither. I knew she was having some trouble with her vampire nature but... I never would've thought it would come to that.  Storing anemic humans with a promise to turn them into vampires?
^They were dying a slow death and she somehow thought that was more merciful than to just drain someone out in one go.
c-1: ^Me?! I took the decision she couldn't take!
^I admit I was harsh, but the situation called for it. She wouldn't listen, we tried being comprehensible before and look where it got us.
g-0: ^They are food. If a vampire starts pitying every human... We cannot live like that.
g-1: ^I think you know what happened. She grew even more distant, quit the band.

s: ^So your solution had the opposite effect.

g-2: ^Not really. Our dynamic did change, she didn't like me keeping her in check, but she never tried to pull anymore of that reckless crap.
^Yeah, I guess maybe I could've done some things differently...

s: ^Why not come to me for help?

g-3: ^Heather only asked me for one thing after all that, and that was to not tell you about it.
^She didn't elaborate on it, but you can take some pretty good guesses as to why.
^Anyway, that's all I had to say.
^I'm sure you will be reasonable about what to do with the information.
^Good luck figuring the other stuff out. It may not have looked like it sometimes, but I have always wished for the best for her.

letsdiscuss: ^Let's discuss once we have more information...
report_back: ^Found out what happened to the young humans you are looking for.
^Not sure how you're going to react to this but...
^They gave her their consent to drink their blood, if she promised to turn them into vampires. But then they became so anemic and debilitated they couldn't do anything anymore.
^She kept them in an apartment not far from here. One of them managed to leave and was spotted in an hospital nearby. Alec just finished the job and took care of that so we wouldn't be exposed.
^Even though it was not what she wanted... there was no choice but to kill them in the end.
^To be honest, I was kind of expecting things to have turned out something like that. I do appreciate your honesty.
^Still need to fact check a few things, such as the existence of this apartment.
^Like I said, I'll still keep my end of the agreement and help you find out what happened to Heather.
^He also confirmed that was the reason why she quit the band and they grew apart these past few weeks.
^While you two were talking I managed to snatch these.
^Exactly, and all it took was to sow a bit of discord between the two.
^Let's not waste any time and hopefully find out how or if she's involved in all this.

how_to_procede: ^Let's gather what we know so far:
^We have a lot of seemingly disconnected occurrances going on, the humans killed at the apartment, Heather being threatened, the dead man who was involved with the bloodbag contraband.
^Let's not also forget the people who have shown up looking for supernatural beings.
^Could they be connected? The hospital, in particular, was mentioned twice already.
^If that man's death is not related, why dump him so close to the bar? Specially when he was not suppose to come here until tomorrow.
^I still don't know if I can trust your colleagues' words. They could be trying to point us towards something to avert us from finding out something else.

c-0: ^Everything he said made sense. He really cares about Heather, can't think of a reason why he would lie.

^Yes, but let's not forget how avoidant he was at first, and because he only told some things to you, I personally couldn't judge if I thought he was being frank or not. Plus through the story you told me, he already showed he can be ruthless.
^But I don't know, could an insulted and broken ego be enough of a reason he would do something to Heather?
c-1: ^I've known her the longest and she was always a good friend to me. Plus she already tried to help us multiple times.
^Yes, but let's not forget she does have a personal dislike for Heather and was not hesitant to throw suspicion on both Alec and Jo. She also was cautious to tell us about the bloodbag business.
g-0: ^Both Alec and Loretta seem to agree that Heather was a liability.
^From what we'vev seen so far, Jo does seem like the one who's more likely to threaten someone from afar, seeing as we know Heather owed her money. But what did Heather need the money for?
^Now that we know what we know, it would be smart to use that to convince Jo to let us in her office.
^So let's not waste anymore time and get to it.

Loretta2: ^We managed to look around Jo's office
^We found a finger inside Heather's locker

oocloretta: ^I hope I was able to help.
dbloretta: ^You want me to take care of it?
^You see, we don't think this was done by a vampire, there are no bite marks on him.
^Here's a picture. Do you know him?
^He worked for me. Delivered supplies for the bar.
^Don't know what he did to end up like that, though.
^When was the last time you saw him?
^Last week, the deliveries happen every week.
^So he didn't show up on this one?
^Damn, now I gotta rework all of this out...
^If you find out more, let me know, ok?
sfloretta: ^There's a severed finger in Heather's locker.
^Do you know something about that? Was she being threatened?
^First of all, that's disgusting, I don't care for that at all.
^Second of all... Maybe? I really don't know, honey, I'm sorry.
dbbb: ^He was delivering the bloodbags from the hospital, huh?
^I told you what I thought was relevant.
^I didn't kill the man, jesus. And what if I had?
^You know, if you don't trust me you can check out things by yourselves.
^A spare key to her drawer where she keeps all important documents concerning the bar.
^Maybe you'll find something there that actually helps your investigation.
^And you're just giving this to us?
^Clearly there's something fishy going on and I wanna help you, Inez.
^Saying you can trust me doesn't mean anything by itself, so I'm showing you can trust me.
^But her office is still locked, can you let us inside?
^She keeps it locked when she's around. I'm afraid you'll have to figure out your own way inside.

interrogateloretta: ^Have you been to (insert here hospital name) recently?
^Really? What for? If you don't mind.
^I do business there. Have suppliers and all.
^We actually have a lead on the hospital, one of the people I'm looking for was spotted there.
^Well, I don't know anything about that, honey, otherwise I would've said so.
^I take it you don't know anything about this empty bloodbag we found in the trash outside either?
^Yeah and what kind of business you need a fake id card for, Loretta?
^What is she doing? Trying to point the finger in my direction?
^It's honestly idiotic, because it's her business too.
^We get our blood from there. From their bloodbags. It's how we make the drinks
^Exactly. It's easier, we don't have to kill, drain people and store it all by ourselves.
^But you're taking it from sick people who really need it.
^We need it too. If you think about it like that, we also have a... condition.

g-0: ^As for you detective, I don't see how this has anything to do with Heather or the other disappearences.
^So if all you're going to do is judge me because you think you're on some sort of moral highground, then I'm afraid-
^No need, I think our conversation is over anyway. Thank you for clearing this up.
^Just... You people have so many ways of getting what you need, why exploit who's already vulnerable?
^Honey, there's not a single humans who's not vulnerable to us.
^Huh, maybe you and Heather would've gotten along, detective.

checkwloretta: ^No- nothing. How did you do it?
^Just like that? That doesn't sound like the Jo I know...
^For starters, you were wrong. The bloodbag delivery happens today.
^You're sure? I'm not usually wrong about something like that...
^We saw it on the agenda and Jo confirmed it.
^Guess that settles it then. Sorry for my mistake.

c-0: ^I'm having a hard time trusting anything you say, Loretta.
c-1: ^You would never get something like that wrong.
g-0: ^We listened to the voice message you left Jo.
^You cut off at times. We couldn't listen to the whole thing.
^What exactly did you hear me say then?
^"Shit- Just so you're aware, there's been a situation... What the- Made a whole damn mess-"
^Ok, I can see how... I'll clear everything up, just please hold off your judgement.
^I need to serve these costumers first, just give me a few seconds...
^The next day she showed up on time, I explained to her that she was suppose to help deliver a shipment for the drinks. Support our contact.
^They never returned and I didn't hear anything else about it until you two found him in the trashcan.
^I blame myself, it was too much to trust that she could even do this one simple thing right.

c-2: ^I didn't know you would... Actually insist so much on the idea something happened to her. Isn't it clear now? She dumped him, took his van and left town.
^Also, the truth is: I just didn't think you would believe me.
c-3: ^Ok, believe what you want. God, I knew you would do that. See the worst in me.
^Bet you still don't think she took off on her own, huh?
^She dumped that man in trash, took his van and left town.
^You know, that's why I didn't tell you the whole thing.

g-1: ^I know what Heather says, I noticed how you changed with me after getting with her.
^So of course you would see me as the wrongdoer.

c-4: ^ and I should've listened to her more.
c-5: ^ I'm still trying to understand things.

g-2: ^Er... Before you two start getting into more personal matters...
^I curious about something: what exactly did you hear Heather and Jo argue behind the door?
^Oh... Nothing. There was no time, the door started to open so I had to rush back.
^I just left the impression that I might have heard something.
g-3: ^I don't know, I... Isn't it obvious?
^I did it for Inez, not for Heather.
^I know it's silly, but I thought eventually, when everything worked out, you would've been happy to know I was there for Heather.

s: ^So you just wanted to look good?

c-7: ^If you wanna put it like that...
^Is that bad? I wanted to clear the air.

g-4: ^Because of all the tension between me and Heather. I wanted to show you I'm ok with her and vice versa, so she would've be ok with me too.
^It truly was a gesture of good faith. I got scared you could distance yourself from me and I don't want that. There's nothing I want less in the world than that.

c-9: ^Yeah, you say that but... I don't know.
c-10: ^That's it? You don't seem that convinced.

g-5: ^Listen, I would like to explain more but in private. Nothing that relates to this whole thing with Heather- just you and me.
^Come talk to me later, but only if you want.
